intro: Microlicia johnwurdackiana, commonly known as the Wurdack's microlicia, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of mostly flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth surface. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in the humid and shaded conditions of the forest floor. Microlicia johnwurdackiana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
